chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
K: AbsRing
V: NormedModule K

Goal:
forall (l : K) (x : V), norm (scal l x) <= abs l * norm x

Premises:
norm = NormedModule.norm K (NormedModuleAux.Pack K V (NormedModule.class K V) V) (NormedModule.class K V) : V -> R
scal = fun (K : Ring) (V : ModuleSpace K) => ModuleSpace.scal K (AbelianGroup.Pack V (ModuleSpace.class K V) V) (ModuleSpace.class K V) : forall (K : Ring) (V : ModuleSpace K), K -> V -> V Arguments K, V are implicit and maximally inserted
abs = fun K : AbsRing => AbsRing.abs (Ring.Pack K (AbsRing.class K) K) (AbsRing.class K) : forall K : AbsRing, K -> R Argument K is implicit and maximally inserted
Notation NormedModule := NormedModule.type
NormedModule.Mixin : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModuleAux K) (norm : V -> R) (norm_factor : R), (forall x y : V, norm (plus x y) <= norm x + norm y) -> (forall (l : K) (x : V), norm (scal l x) <= abs l * norm x) -> (forall (x y : V) (eps : R), norm (minus y x) < eps -> ball x eps y) -> (forall (x y : V) (eps : posreal), ball x eps y -> norm (minus y x) < norm_factor * eps) -> (forall x : V, norm x = 0 -> x = zero) -> NormedModule.mixin_of K V
Record mixin_of (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModuleAux K) : Type := Mixin { norm : V -> R; norm_factor : R; ax1 : forall x y : V, norm (plus x y) <= norm x + norm y; ax2 : forall (l : K) (x : V), norm (scal l x) <= abs l * norm x; ax3 : forall (x y : V) (eps : R), norm (minus y x) < eps -> ball x eps y; ax4 : forall (x y : V) (eps : posreal), ball x eps y -> norm (minus y x) < norm_factor * eps; ax5 : forall x : V, norm x = 0 -> x = zero } For Mixin: Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope R_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
NormedModule.ax2 : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModuleAux K) (m : NormedModule.mixin_of K V) (l : K) (x : V), NormedModule.norm K V m (scal l x) <= abs l * NormedModule.norm K V m x
norm_triangle : forall x y : V, norm (plus x y) <= norm x + norm y
RiemannInt_const_bound : forall (f : R -> R) (a b l u : R) (h : Riemann_integrable f a b), a <= b -> (forall x : R, a < x < b -> l <= f x <= u) -> l * (b - a) <= RiemannInt h <= u * (b - a)
ModuleSpace.Mixin : forall (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) (scal : K -> V -> V), (forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal x (scal y u) = scal (mult x y) u) -> (forall u : V, scal one u = u) -> (forall (x : K) (u v : V), scal x (plus u v) = plus (scal x u) (scal x v)) -> (forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal (plus x y) u = plus (scal x u) (scal y u)) -> ModuleSpace.mixin_of K V
Un_cv_crit_lub : forall Un : nat -> R, Un_growing Un -> forall l : R, is_lub (EUn Un) l -> Un_cv Un l
abs_mult : forall x y : ?K, abs (mult x y) <= abs x * abs y where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing]
Record mixin_of (K : Ring) (V : AbelianGroup) : Type := Mixin { scal : K -> V -> V; ax1 : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal x (scal y u) = scal (mult x y) u; ax2 : forall u : V, scal one u = u; ax3 : forall (x : K) (u v : V), scal x (plus u v) = plus (scal x u) (scal x v); ax4 : forall (x y : K) (u : V), scal (plus x y) u = plus (scal x u) (scal y u) } For Mixin: Argument scopes are [_ _ function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope]
abs_opp : forall x : ?K, abs (opp x) = abs x where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing]
abs_pow_n : forall (x : ?K) (n : nat), abs (pow_n x n) <= abs x ^ n where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing]
scal_opp_l : forall (x : ?K) (u : ?V), scal (opp x) u = opp (scal x u) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Ring] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- ModuleSpace ?K]
abs_minus : forall x y : ?K, abs (minus x y) = abs (minus y x) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing]
abs_triangle : forall x y : ?K, abs (plus x y) <= abs x + abs y where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing]
scal_minus_distr_l : forall (x : ?K) (u v : ?V), scal x (minus u v) = minus (scal x u) (scal x v) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Ring] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- ModuleSpace ?K]
scal_distr_r : forall (x y : ?K) (u : ?V), scal (plus x y) u = plus (scal x u) (scal y u) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Ring] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- ModuleSpace ?K]
scal_distr_l : forall (x : ?K) (u v : ?V), scal x (plus u v) = plus (scal x u) (scal x v) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Ring] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- ModuleSpace ?K]
scal_minus_distr_r : forall (x y : ?K) (u : ?V), scal (minus x y) u = minus (scal x u) (scal y u) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Ring] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- ModuleSpace ?K]
abs_ge_0 : forall x : ?K, 0 <= abs x where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- AbsRing]
natr_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list nat) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr N * Ring_polynom.PExpr N)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr N), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0%nat 1%nat Init.Nat.add Init.Nat.mul (SRsub Init.Nat.add) (SRopp (R:=nat)) eq N.to_nat id_phi_N (pow_N 1%nat Init.Nat.mul) l lpe -> (let lmp := Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list 0%N 1%N N.add N.mul N.add (fun x : N => x) N.eqb N.div_eucl lpe in Ring_polynom.Peq N.eqb (Ring_polynom.norm_subst 0%N 1%N N.add N.mul N.add (fun x : N => x) N.eqb N.div_eucl n lmp pe1) (Ring_polynom.norm_subst ...
scal_opp_r : forall (x : ?K) (u : ?V), scal x (opp u) = opp (scal x u) where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Ring] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- ModuleSpace ?K]
scal_assoc : forall (x y : ?K) (u : ?V), scal x (scal y u) = scal (mult x y) u where ?K : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- Ring] ?V : [K : AbsRing V : NormedModule K |- ModuleSpace ?K]
RField_lemma5 : forall (l : list R) (l1 : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)), (forall lock : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z) -> Prop, lock = PCond 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq IZR N.to_nat pow l -> lock (Fapp (Fcons2 0%Z 1%Z Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.quotrem) l1 Datatypes.nil)) -> PCond 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq IZR N.to_nat pow l l1
Un_cv = fun (Un : nat -> R) (l : R) => forall eps : R, eps > 0 -> exists N : nat, forall n : nat, (n >= N)%nat -> R_dist (Un n) l < eps : (nat -> R) -> R -> Prop Argument scopes are [function_scope R_scope]
Record mixin_of (K : Ring) : Type := Mixin { abs : K -> R; ax1 : abs zero = 0; ax2 : abs (opp one) = 1; ax3 : forall x y : K, abs (plus x y) <= abs x + abs y; ax4 : forall x y : K, abs (mult x y) <= abs x * abs y; ax5 : forall x : K, abs x = 0 -> x = zero } For Mixin: Argument scopes are [_ function_scope _ _ function_scope function_scope function_scope]
abs_zero = fun K : AbsRing => AbsRing.ax1 (Ring.Pack K (AbsRing.class K) K) (AbsRing.class K) : forall K : AbsRing, abs zero = 0 Argument K is implicit and maximally inserted
NormedModule.ax1 : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModuleAux K) (m : NormedModule.mixin_of K V) (x y : V), NormedModule.norm K V m (plus x y) <= NormedModule.norm K V m x + NormedModule.norm K V m y
RField_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list R) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr Z), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp eq IZR N.to_nat pow l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp IZR N.to_nat pow l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Rplus Rmult Rminus Ropp IZR N.to_nat pow l pe2
NormedModule.ax5 : forall (K : AbsRing) (V : NormedModuleAux K) (m : NormedModule.mixin_of K V) (x : V), NormedModule.norm K V m x = 0 -> x = zero
AbsRing.ax4 : forall (K : Ring) (m : AbsRing.mixin_of K) (x y : K), AbsRing.abs K m (mult x y) <= AbsRing.abs K m x * AbsRing.abs K m y

```coq
intros l x.
apply NormedModule.ax2.
Qed.
```
